title: Pocosin Lakes Avoided Conversion Project
tagline:
Pocosin
 Lakes Forest Conservation Project is comprised of 1,349 acres of forested land in Tyrrell County, North
Carolina. The property has been placed under a conservation easement to ensure that the 
natural land will not be disturbed by human development.
project_overview: Placed under a conservation easement with the USDA, the Pocosin Lakes Projects ensure that the natural land will not be disturbed by human development such as burning, digging, plowing, draining, or planting crop. In the absence of this protection, the forest would have been harvested, burned on site, and converted to agricultural land for wheat or corn crop production, similar to neighboring properties. The management practices of the project allow the forest to regenerate naturally, which will promote and maintain a diversity of native species and forests comprised of multiple ages and mixed native species at multiple land cape scales. The project sequesters around 15 000 metric tons of CO2 per year. The project provides a sustainable and protected habitat for the mixed hardwood and conifer forest, as well as the animals that live within it. The project also supports healthy populations of red wolf, bald eagle, black bear, and neotropical migratory bird species.

project_images.caption: Photography, hiking, and bird viewing are encouraged on the property.
Pine trees is the more abundant specie on this project.

verifiability.text: An objective third party—someone other than the land owner or Blue Source—must be able to look at project data and confirm that the carbon reductions are real and credible. SCS Global Services and Environmental Services, Inc. acted as the third-parties verifiers in this project, who determined greenhouse gas reductions and verified that the reductions adhere to strict monitoring and reporting standards.

tagline_footer: With every ton of carbon that is sold, trees are protected, partnerships are formed, and our living Earth is restored to help solve climate change.
